name: The Biblical Story of Hannah Trivia Quiz | Old Testament / Tanakh People | 10 Questions

questions.text: What two promises did Hannah make to God if He would give her a son?
questions.correct: The son would be given to God and no razor would be used on his head
options: The son would become a priest and never marry
The son would love the Lord and she would pray every day
He would be dedicated to God and she would offer daily sacrifices at Shiloh
questions.explanation:
The son would be given to God and no razor would be used on his head.

	I Samuel 1:11

Elkanah.

	I Samuel 1:1 - He seemed to be a loving and supportive husband.

questions.text: On the day of sacrifice, Hannah's husband would give a portion of the meat to his other wife (Peninnah) and her children. What would he give Hannah?
questions.correct: a double portion of meat, because he loved her
options: no meat because she would be fasting
nothing, he did not love her because she was childless
less meat because she had no children
questions.explanation:
a double portion of meat, because he loved her.

	I Samuel 1:4-5

questions.text: What would Hannah's rival (Peninnah) do when they would go to the House of the Lord?
Why did the priest accuse Hannah of being drunk?
questions.explanation:
She was praying intently.

	I Samuel 1:9-14 - Though Hannah's lips moved to the words of her prayer, she did not use her voice. This looked suspicious to the priest.

questions.text: God did bless Hannah with a son. What did she name him?
questions.explanation:
Samuel & Shemuel & Shmuel.

	His name sounds like a Hebrew phrase that means 'heard of God'. 1 Samuel 1:20

questions.text: When did Hannah take the boy to the House of the Lord?
options: After the Lord spoke to her heart and told her 'it's time'.
questions.explanation:
After he was weaned.

	I Samuel 21-28

questions.text: Who was the priest who cared for her son?
In her prayer, at the dedication of her son, what does Hannah say the LORD will guard?
options: the heart of the priest who will train her son
questions.explanation:
The feet of his saints.

	A great promise - I Samuel 2:9

questions.text: The Lord was with Hannah's son as he grew. Soon all Israel recognized that this boy would become a great....?
